Penalty and Interest for Late PAYE Remittance (as per Finance Act 2020 and PITA)

penalty_and_interest.Rd

The penalty_and_interest() function computes the penalty and interest applicable to late remittance of Pay-As-You-Earn (PAYE) taxes, in accordance with the Personal Income Tax Act (PITA) and the Finance Act 2020 of Nigeria. Employers are required to remit deducted PAYE taxes on or before the 10th day of the month following the month of deduction. Failure to remit within this timeline attracts a penalty and interest as specified in the law.

Usage

penalty_and_interest(unpaid_tax, due_date, payment_date)

Arguments

unpaid_tax

Numeric. The outstanding PAYE tax amount that was not remitted on time.

due_date

Character or Date. The statutory due date for the PAYE remittance (usually the 10th of the following month).

payment_date

Character or Date. The actual remittance date. Must be convertible to a Date.

Value

A list containing:

Unpaid_Tax

Original unpaid PAYE amount.

Days_Overdue

Number of days past the due date.

Interest_Amount

Calculated interest on overdue amount (rounded to 2 decimal places).

Penalty_Amount

Penalty based on employer type (NGN 50,000 or NGN 500,000).

Total_Liability

Sum of tax, interest, and penalty (rounded to 2 decimal places).

Details

The Finance Act 2020, amending relevant sections of PITA, specifies that:

  • Interest shall accrue at the prevailing Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) minimum rediscount rate (currently approximated at 21%) on a daily basis until payment is made.

The function performs the following operations:

  • Converts due_date and payment_date to Date objects.

  • If payment_date is on or before due_date, it returns a message indicating no penalty or interest applies.

  • Otherwise, calculates the number of days overdue.

  • Uses a daily interest rate derived from an annual rate of 21% (0.21 / 365).

  • Computes the interest accrued on the unpaid tax for the number of days overdue.

  • Calculates the total liability as the sum of the original tax, interest, and penalty.

Examples

# On-time remittance
penalty_and_interest(1000000, "2024-01-10", "2024-01-10")
#> [1] "No penalty or interest. Payment was made on time."

# Late remittance by corporate employer
penalty_and_interest(1000000, "2024-01-10", "2024-03-01")
#> $Unpaid_Tax
#> [1] 1e+06
#> 
#> $Days_Overdue
#> [1] 51
#> 
#> $Interest_Amount
#> [1] 29342.47
#> 
#> $Penalty_Amount
#> [1] 1e+05
#> 
#> $Total_Liability
#> [1] 1129342
#> 

# Late remittance by individual employer
penalty_and_interest(1000000, "2024-01-10", "2024-03-01")
#> $Unpaid_Tax
#> [1] 1e+06
#> 
#> $Days_Overdue
#> [1] 51
#> 
#> $Interest_Amount
#> [1] 29342.47
#> 
#> $Penalty_Amount
#> [1] 1e+05
#> 
#> $Total_Liability
#> [1] 1129342
#>
